name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s particular maladies have created a moment in which Biden’s greatest strengths as a person are most needed by the nation. Things like decency, honor, respect, and, yes, empathy are on the ballot," @Peter_Wehner writes: https://t.co/gyKFZ9nA5I

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump needs to squeeze even more votes out of rural and small-town America to offset his losses elsewhere, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/OqeBTNmGf1

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Obsessing over the probabilities of unique one-off events that we have an infinitesimally small amount of individual control over—like a presidential election—is a metaphysically strange thing to do," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/9ndejv9Xws

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump may wage a war of disinformation if election results don’t go his way, @McKayCoppins warns—and the “Army for Trump” is gearing up to help. https://t.co/4iTsEwHvHK

name: TheAtlantic
text: The news media are not overblowing the pandemic’s severity ahead of Election Day. That and more in @realcpaz’s tracker of Trump’s lies: https://t.co/00WE4qK7Ry

name: TheAtlantic
text: David Jay, a founder of the asexual movement, “wanted kids and also wanted a co-parent to help him raise kids, but wasn’t interested in romantic partnership.” So he created his own three-parent household, Angela Chen reported in September. https://t.co/LlyKVBHmR5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch: The 2020 presidential race could be remembered as a hinge point in the nation’s history. Tomorrow at 11 ET, join Atlantic senior editor @RonBrownstein, assistant editor @realcpaz, and staff writer @DkThomp for a live Election Day discussion. https://t.co/VMXwqz7q7Q

name: TheAtlantic
text: The American election isn't just crucial for Americans. In many ways, it is an existential vote for Britain, too, @TomMcTague writes: https://t.co/vgO6wVTvmD

name: TheAtlantic
text: “In public, Biden and his senior advisers profess full confidence in the electoral system to work as it always has,” @bartongellman writes. “Behind the scenes, they are preparing for the worst.” https://t.co/4zewL5B1WX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @realcpaz: It’s Election Day in America. Here’s how @TheAtlantic’s journalists will watch the results unfold.  https://t.co/7yAD0JJYop

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "This year, it is incumbent on the press to respect each citizen’s constitutional right to vote by not 'calling' this election based on early or incomplete data under pressure from President Trump." --  @kimwehle:
https://t.co/QqLdu89Blu

name: TheAtlantic
text: How can you actually figure out what's happening tonight? @NickBaumann and The Atlantic's Politics team have some advice: https://t.co/8BR8Hpf0dI

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Instead of identifying with an old notion of the American dream, new citizens like me can advance a truer story," @azhang852 writes: https://t.co/YBF39ck2wv

name: TheAtlantic
text: Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders make up 4 percent of Pennsylvania’s voting-age population. @shuranphoto and @erjlee photographed 12 of these voters and asked them who they’re supporting and why. https://t.co/yFwHB0sL5P

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: This, from @NickBaumann, is hugely helpful. Keep this tab open later today:
https://t.co/YipotDDWdu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: This, from @elcush, is highly useful:
https://t.co/JyM0T2BwC4

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @whitdangerfield: "Instead of identifying with an old notion of the American dream, new citizens like me can advance a truer story," @azhang852 writes: https://t.co/933eFTnyO0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Whatever happens this week, we'll continue to cover the Trump presidency. In the meantime, @elcush compiled a list of our most essential reporting on Trump’s first term as it happened. https://t.co/XJNoHdZcy3

name: TheAtlantic
text: 1/ Which voters are worth watching this election? Here’s who our editors and writers have had their eyes on.

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2/ The Democrats might need higher-than-ever Latino turnout to help Joe Biden secure a win, but many Latino communities struggling during the pandemic felt overlooked by the former vice president’s campaign, @realcpaz wrote in September. https://t.co/NX2xCOLFeh

name: TheAtlantic
text: 3/ And in their efforts to win over Latinos, @realcpaz writes, many liberals have overlooked the key reasons Donald Trump might appeal to the demographic. https://t.co/WDMSkr4ciA

name: TheAtlantic
text: 4/ Trump, meanwhile, has placed his chances in the hands of rural white voters, even as portions of that base have since recoiled, @RussellBerman reports. https://t.co/S2maM6C8pT

name: TheAtlantic
text:
5/ The Catholic vote could be a close call—including in Pennsylvania, @emmaogreen reports. Joe Biden’s wholesome presentation is cultivated to appeal to his childhood neighbors, a Catholic voting bloc in a state that could determine the election.  
https://t.co/eovw2dVV4U

name: TheAtlantic
text: 6/ The Biden campaign’s final days were also spent making a final pitch to Black men. “Although Black women have often been called ‘the backbone of the Democratic Party,’ Black men have not been reliably Democratic in such large numbers,” @adamhsays writes.https://t.co/mibF3EDeXG

name: TheAtlantic
text: 7/ Download our app for more election coverage: https://t.co/QKOJcmtBgO

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Counting ballots takes time—whether they are cast in person or by mail, and nothing requires that the process arbitrarily stop on Election Day. This has always been true. Nothing is different this round," @kimwehle writes: https://t.co/ShHSSG4jGF

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: NEW: In February, Jeff Bezos promised to spend $10 billion fighting climate change. Little has been heard since.

But that’s about to change, I’ve learned. Bezos is preparing to give $100 million each to some of the country’s largest environmental groups: 
https://t.co/94lz6dDOhv

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: .@jpinsk explains why 2016 was actually 1000 years ago, and what big moments like Election Day do to our sense of time

https://t.co/AKiwgZrQ9T

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @cray_kate: Watch parties have been part of presidential elections for years. But with a deadly pandemic at hand, a rule-flouting leader in office, and life-changing policies on the line, this year feels different for many Americans.

My latest for @TheAtlantic: https://t.co/RT3wEeaPNu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @jpinsk: An American who reaches life expectancy lives through only 19 or 20 presidential elections. 

I wrote a little piece about how each one is a "temporal landmark" that shapes our perception of time passing:

https://t.co/EVtRjxSf5L @TheAtlantic

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: I spent the last few days putting together an hour-by-hour Election Night guide for myself in the Notes app and then realized I might as well publish it. I hope it's helpful to people!

https://t.co/IH5kYqnxFa

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: A really interesting argument from @greg_shill that by treating vehicular attacks differently than attacks with firearms, we’re making more attacks all but inevitable: https://t.co/ojY34aNs28

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Blue Texas may not be a reality yet, but the days of state politics being just a battle between the right and the center-right could be over," @AdamSerwer writes: https://t.co/mvfGOpI4nm

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: I have to say it… Readers of @TheAtlantic’s new climate newsletter, The Weekly Planet, were the first to know about this Jeff Bezos scoop.

You don’t have to subscribe to The Atlantic to get the Weekly Planet in your inbox. It’s free. Sign up for it now: https://t.co/5ivVQOgYpc https://t.co/nGYDvPdk3q

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch parties have been part of presidential elections for years. But with a deadly pandemic at hand, a rule-flouting leader in office, and life-changing policies on the line, this year feels different for many Americans, @cray_kate reports: https://t.co/36OzXimWtb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As always, we should be reflexively skeptical of surprising exit polls. This year in particular, we should be cautious about drawing overconfident conclusions from early results," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/a9fQFO1ayM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Jeff Bezos is now ready to start giving some of the $10 billion he pledged to help fight climate change. But his gifts indicate that he isn’t trying something new so much as boosting an ancien régime, @yayitsrob reports: https://t.co/FUldGVn4CH

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Scenes From New Zealand - 33 photos from this island country. On a day when much of the world’s attention is focused on the United States, I thought it might be nice to share some images from the other side of the planet. https://t.co/ymPkZQYXBN https://t.co/9YwQbrf36U

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamSerwer: Not gonna be on here much today but here’s a quick piece on what’s happening in Texas: GOP dominance of the state has long been contingent on restricting the electorate. With this level of turnout, the outcome here is unknown for the first time in decades https://t.co/n0P7iCHu8P

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: This, from @GrahamDavidA, remains an essential read: https://t.co/gQ5VdSAofr

name: TheAtlantic
text: A collection of photographs from the North Island, the South Island, and a few of the other 600 islands that make up the nation of New Zealand, via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/ltfvwDksQi https://t.co/SDDOrtT8Gb
